claim: "The coronavirus was invented and patented in the USA and then planted in China."
label: false
evidences: the best available information is that the virus originated in china with an animal and then spread to humans.

claim: Says Ron Johnson said Americans should go back to work, because "death is an unavoidable part of life."
label: half-true
evidences: johnson did use the line about death being unavoidable, but the headline exaggerates his position, implying he thinks all or most people should go back to work.

claim: Media outlets reported that the same boy died 3 times from the coronavirus, in 3 countries.
label: pants-fire
evidences: it's unclear where the screenshot combining godinho's photo and abdulwahab's name originated.

claim: "We were slow with the testing, but very quick with the travel ban. And that's been much more critical in saving lives."
label: false
evidences: travel restrictions could have bought a bit of time.

claim: "President Trump, COVID-19 coronavirus: U.S. cases 1,329; U.S. deaths, 38; panic level: mass hysteria. President Obama, H1N1 virus: U.S. cases, 60.8 million; U.S. deaths, 12,469; panic level: totally chill. Do you all see how the media can manipulate your life."
label: barely-true
evidences: and while it's too soon to calculate how deadly covid-19 will be, two experts told us it is clearly more deadly than h1n1.

claim: The Obama administration "didn't do anything about" swine flu.
label: false
evidences: his assessment on the nation's response is incorrect.

claim: Says Donald Trump tweeted, "I ordered the Treasury secretary to send checks to Americans! First however, we will go through your social media history from the last 4 years and search for any post with #NotMyPresident in it. I wouldn't think of offending you with a check if I'm not your president! #MAGA"
label: pants-fire
evidences: i wouldn't think of offending you with a check if i'm not your president!

claim: Says Spectrum will provide free internet to students during coronavirus school closures.
label: true
evidences: starting march 16, charter also started waiving installation fees for new student households and opening its wifi hotspots for public use to, it said, "ease the strain during this challenging time."

claim: The Obama administration left Trump with a "stockpile with a cupboard that was bare."
label: barely-true
evidences: in one specific way, he has a point: n95 masks were depleted after the h1n1 outbreak in 2009, and experts warned years ago that the supply should have been replenished.

claim: Says 80% of novel coronavirus cases are "mild."
label: mostly-true
evidences: it's important to note that different age groups have had different levels of severity.

claim: Says "the coronavirus was engineered by scientists in a lab."
label: false
evidences: other blogs and social media users have speculated that a lab near wuhan could be the source of the virus.

claim: "Covid-19 is now the leading cause of death in the United States."
label: half-true
evidences: that's true only if you compare the number of people dying of coronavirus daily against estimates of other causes from previous years.

claim: Says "there is no" COVID-19 virus.
label: pants-fire
evidences: the who has declared the covid-19 outbreak to be a pandemic and global health emergency.

claim: "Bill Gates told us about the coronavirus in 2015."
label: mostly-true
evidences: he talks about an epidemic and we're now in the midst of a pandemic.

claim: "The coronavirus has made it to Mississippi and the lady that caught it wasn't around nobody with it which means it is airborne. That means if the wind blows it your direction you'll have it also."
label: false
evidences: we're still learning about the coronavirus and how it spreads, but this isn't accurate.

claim: "The (corona)virus just isn't nearly as deadly as we thought it was."
label: barely-true
evidences: scientists warned early in the outbreak that the raw number of confirmed cases didn't give a fully accurate picture of mortality.

claim: Says Dr. Anthony Fauci "stands to lose 100 million dollars on Bill Gates 'vaccine' for the coronavirus. Because he invested in this vaccine."
label: false
evidences: there are 70 potential covid-19 vaccines in development, one of which was created by niaid scientists in partnership with moderna, inc. that vaccine is being manufactured by an organization that the gates foundation supports, but there's no evidence that niaid or fauci will directly profit from that support.

claim: Says CEOs got advance notice of COVID, then resigned to dump stock.
label: false
evidences: among the companies listed, only two of the ceos resigned after the coronavirus outbreak and left their companies.

claim: Walmart, Amazon, Kroger, Target and Costco "have not had any reported (coronavirus) cases in the news."
label: false
evidences: covid-19 infected more target employees at stores in georgia, north dakota, north carolina, and california.

claim: "During the flu pandemic of 1918, some cities lifted social distancing measures too fast, too soon, and created a second wave of pandemic."
label: mostly-true
evidences: typically, when social distancing ends, there is a second wave.

claim: Mosquitoes can transfer COVID-19 "from person to person"
label: false
evidences: instead, it is transferred via droplets of saliva or discharge from the nose.

claim: Says 44 senators "voted NOT to send stimulus checks."
label: false
evidences: the "main hang-up on the bill," vox reported, was that democrats objected to $500 billion earmarked for big companies and industries affected by the coronavirus.

claim: The federal government is "preparing to mobilize the national guard," "dispatch them across the US with military" and "announce a nationwide 1 week quarantine for all citizens."
label: false
evidences: as for the stafford act, trump invoked the law march 13, thereby authorizing aid for state and local governments grappling with the coronavirus and waiving certain regulations that impede access to health care.

claim: Says Democrats are on vacation until May 4 and "refuse to come back" to sign a bill to help small businesses.
label: false
evidences: the legislation could be approved by unanimous consent, which does not require a majority of members to be present.

claim: "All US citizens are entitled to $700 USD per week to stay at home to avoid the spread of COVID-19 novel coronavirus, starting from March 17."
label: false
evidences: this post was flagged as part of facebook's efforts to combat false news and misinformation on its news feed.

claim: "Queen Elizabeth tests positive for COVID-19."
label: false
evidences: so far, the news out of buckingham palace is good.

claim: Says coronavirus is just "the damn flu."
label: pants-fire
evidences: there is indeed overlap in some basic areas - what symptoms it causes, how it is spread, who is most at risk, etc.

claim: Starting in March if you travel outside of the United States you won't be allowed back in the country "due to high risk of the coronavirus."
label: false
evidences: american airlines and delta air lines are both halting flights to and from milan, italy, as well as several airports in or around china.

claim: Says Nevada Gov. Steve Sisolak "has banned the use of an anti-malaria drug that might help cure coronavirus."
label: barely-true
evidences: nevada's emergency regulation restricts the prescription of chloroquine for covid-19 patients in outpatient settings, but not in hospitals and emergency rooms.

claim: The CDC recommends that only people with COVID-19 symptoms should wear masks.
label: false
evidences: that was the cdc's advice - until a change made april 3. now, to guard against the spread of the coronavirus, the cdc recommends nearly everyone wear a cloth face covering when out in public and where social distancing is more difficult.

claim: Says for otherwise healthy people "experiencing mild to moderate respiratory symptoms with or without a COVID-19 diagnosis ... only high temperatures kill a virus, so let your fever run high," but not over 103 or 104 degrees.
label: barely-true
evidences: generally speaking, a fever under 103 degrees doesn't necessarily need treatment.

claim: Suggests Trump urged sick people to get out and vote during COVID-19 pandemic
label: false
evidences: trump said the words, but the statement was not targeted at americans who have been sickened by the novel coronavirus, as the post suggests.

claim: Drinking "water a lot and gargling with warm water & salt or vinegar eliminates" the coronavirus.
label: false
evidences: so drinking lots of water, or gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar, won't eliminate it.

claim: Says of President Donald Trump's actions on the coronavirus: "No. 1, he fired the pandemic team two years ago. No. 2, he's been defunding the Centers for Disease Control."
label: half-true
evidences: 1, he fired the pandemic team two years ago.

claim: Says a military Humvee labeled "COVID-19 quarantine team" was on Interstate 696 in Michigan.
label: false
evidences: searching for "covid-19 quarantine team" online turned up only links to fact-checks, unsubstantiated social media posts and forums like 4chan, the source of several high-profile conspiracy theories.

claim: "Non-essential people get to file for unemployment and make two to three times more than normal," but essential workers still on the job get no pay raise.
label: half-true
evidences: this dynamic only applies to some workers who have modest incomes.

claim: Shows a waitress saying, "I lost my job. But I'll sleep better knowing" that the coronavirus relief bill included funding for the Kennedy Center, refugee resettlement, PBS, and congressional salaries: "Thanks, Democrats"
label: barely-true
evidences: but i'll sleep better knowing" that the coronavirus relief bill included funding for the kennedy center, refugee resettlement, pbs, and congressional salaries: "thanks, democrats."

claim: "People defying stay-at-home order fill Arizona beaches."
label: pants-fire
evidences: doug ducey issued a stay-at-home order that runs through april 30, and has made no decision on whether to extend it.

claim: "Small trials" to test convalescent plasma therapy for coronavirus patients "seem to have had some degree of success."
label: true
evidences: we found two chinese studies that have found initial success, though more research is needed to confirm these results more broadly.

claim: Models projecting COVID-19 deaths "are talking about without mitigation."
label: false
evidences: the johns hopkins data was preliminary, and not designed as a forecast.

claim: "Huge! Results From Breaking Chloroquine Study Show 100% Cure Rate For Patients Infected With The Coronavirus."
label: false
evidences: the french study of the drug on 20 patients with covid-19 indicates it could help with treatment, but it is no sure cure.

claim: Says the Chinese Communist Party "will finally admit that the real source of the coronavirus is from 'a lab in Wuhan' linked to its covert biological weapon programs."
label: false
evidences: their findings suggest "a likely single, recent emergence from a virus related to bat coronaviruses and the sars coronavirus."

claim: "The poor are, ironically, the most likely to be employed in the industries deemed 'essential' while their upper-class peers are freed to bunker down for weeks until the first death wave passes."
label: true
evidences: our data analysis shows that the vast majority of workers wolf deemed essential earn low and working class wages, and a recent analysis by the washington post shows that many white collar workers say they're able to telecommute.

claim: "'Private' messages sent to individual people during a Zoom meeting show up in the end-of-meeting transcript along with all other public messages."
label: half-true
evidences: "if you (the meeting host) save the chat log for yourself, it will also include private chats you've been involved in, so be very careful about sharing that file with anyone else.

claim: "Florida hospital reports a coronavirus 'infestation' with multiple confirmed patients."
label: false
evidences: we reached out to doctors hospital and yourcontent for comment, but we haven't heard back.

claim: "New York Times editor admits Biden sexual assault story was censored at behest of Biden campaign."
label: barely-true
evidences: the times removed 13 words from a 2,500-word story about a new sexual assault allegation against biden.

claim: "In 'Resident Evil' the Umbrella Corporation releases a virus that infects the people of Raccoon City. A biological research lab with the exact same logo as the Umbrella Corporation can be found in the city where the coronavirus outbreak originated."
label: false
evidences: what's more, there's no evidence that the novel 2019 coronavirus was created in a lab.

claim: "CORONAVIRUS: Reports of 10,000 DEAD in Wuhan, China."
label: pants-fire
evidences: there is nothing but mostly anonymous hearsay to back it up.

claim: The Gates Foundation "tested a polio vax in India between 2000 & 2017 and paralysed 496,000 children."
label: false
evidences: but data from the who show that, between 2000 and 2017, there were 17 cases of vaccine-derived poliovirus.

claim: "Some states are only getting 50 tests per day, and the Utah Jazz got 58."
label: true
evidences: oklahoma public health officials quickly completed tests on 58 people who had had recent contact with gobert, the jazz's center, after he tested positive for covid-19.

claim: "This particular pandemic is one where I don't think nationwide, there's been a single fatality under 25."
label: pants-fire
evidences: that's wrong, according to the cdc, contemporaneous news reports and the counts of state health officials in places like new york.
